model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Have you talked to your advisor about your career options? Teaching is probably a good idea since it is a more guaranteed job.
Speaker B: Yes, I did talk to my advisor and it was very stressful. Deciding my whole life when I am really unsure! But I think I will get into teaching, it is a stable career.
Speaker A: It sounds like something that you would really like and be good at! I hope it works out. I would love to teach robotics someday.
Speaker B: That is so cool, you must be really smart! I imagine your parents are so proud.
Speaker A: Well I'm studying computer science and learning a lot! My parents are great, they are very supportive. What subject would you want to teach?
Speaker B: I would probably teach English, just because that is most in line with what I am studying. However, I have recently started becoming more interested in history so that is also an option.
Speaker A: Yes I think history is interesting, too! Both of those subjects would be great because there are probably lots of teaching jobs. What kind of history do you like?

[MEMORY]
Speaker B is majoring in linguistics and hopes to turn it into a practical job. This has led Speaker A to be interested in teaching computer science, specifically in the field of robotics. 
Speaker B is majoring in linguistics and hopes to turn it into a practical job. This has led Speaker B to consider getting a masters degree after completing their bachelors and potentially becoming a college professor in linguistics. This decision has made Speaker B feel limited in job opportunities.
